fever_assessment.text:
Based on your description, here are some important considerations:

• A fever above 103°F (39.4°C) in adults or any fever in infants under 3 months requires immediate medical attention
• Persistent fever lasting more than 3 days should be evaluated by a healthcare provider
• Fever accompanied by severe headache, stiff neck, confusion, or rash may indicate a serious condition

cough_symptoms.text: How long have you had this cough?

cough_assessment.text:
A cough can be caused by many conditions from mild viral infections to more serious issues. Consider these factors:

• Cough with fever, shortness of breath, or chest pain needs prompt evaluation
• Green or yellow phlegm may indicate infection
• Blood in phlegm always requires medical attention
• Persistent coughs (over 3 weeks) should be evaluated

Would you like to speak with a healthcare provider?

options.text: Yes, connect me with a provider
I'd like to provide more details

chronic_cough.text:
A cough lasting more than 3 weeks is considered chronic and should be evaluated by a healthcare provider. Common causes include:

• Asthma or allergies
• Acid reflux (GERD)
• Postnasal drip
• Chronic bronchitis
• Medication side effects (e.g., ACE inhibitors)

We recommend scheduling an appointment. Would you like to do that now?

specific_condition.text: What condition would you like information about?

diabetes_info.text:
Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects how your body processes blood sugar (glucose). There are several types:

• Type 1: The body doesn't produce insulin
• Type 2: The body doesn't use insulin properly
• Gestational: Occurs during pregnancy
• Prediabetes: Blood sugar is elevated but not yet diabetic

What specific information about diabetes do you need?

diabetes_symptoms.text:
Common symptoms of diabetes include:

• Increased thirst and urination
• Extreme hunger
• Unexplained weight loss
• Fatigue
• Blurred vision
• Slow-healing sores

Type 1 diabetes symptoms often develop quickly, while Type 2 symptoms may develop gradually or be subtle. Diagnosis is typically done through blood tests measuring blood glucose levels.

Would you like to learn more about diabetes?

options.text: I want to schedule a diabetes screening

diabetes_treatment.text:
Diabetes treatment varies by type and individual needs:

• Type 1: Insulin therapy, carbohydrate counting, regular blood sugar monitoring
• Type 2: Lifestyle changes, medication, possibly insulin
• Gestational: Blood sugar monitoring, diet, exercise, possibly insulin

Regular medical care is essential for managing diabetes effectively. Would you like to speak with a healthcare provider about diabetes treatment?

preventive_care.text: Preventive care helps you stay healthy and detects problems early. What preventive care information are you interested in?

screenings_by_age.text: Please select your age group for recommended health screenings:

screenings_18_39.text:
Recommended screenings for adults 18-39 years:

• Blood pressure: Every 3-5 years (annually if elevated)
• Cholesterol: Every 4-6 years
• Depression: Regularly during annual exams
• Diabetes: If overweight/obese or have other risk factors

Women:
• Cervical cancer: Pap test every 3 years starting at 21
• Breast health: Clinical breast exam

Men:
• Testicular exam: Consider self-exams

Would you like to schedule a preventive care appointment?

screenings_40_64.text:
Recommended screenings for adults 40-64 years:

• Blood pressure: Annually
• Cholesterol: Every 4-6 years
• Colorectal cancer: Starting at 45
• Diabetes: Every 3 years if risk factors present
• Depression: Regularly during annual exams

Women:
• Mammogram: Every 1-2 years starting at 40-45
• Cervical cancer: Pap test every 3 years or HPV/Pap every 5 years

Men:
• Prostate cancer: Discuss with doctor starting at 50 (earlier if high risk)

Would you like to schedule a preventive care appointment?

emergency.text:
⚠️ If this is a life-threatening emergency, call 911 immediately or go to the nearest emergency room.

What type of emergency guidance do you need?

cardiac_emergency.text:
⚠️ IMPORTANT: Chest pain or breathing difficulty may indicate a heart attack or other serious condition requiring immediate medical attention.

CALL 911 IMMEDIATELY or go to the nearest emergency room.

While waiting for emergency services:
• Remain as calm and still as possible
• Loosen tight clothing
• If not allergic to aspirin and heart attack is suspected, chew a regular aspirin
• If prescribed, use nitroglycerin as directed

Do you need emergency contact information?

stroke_emergency.text:
⚠️ IMPORTANT: Stroke is a medical emergency. Use the FAST method to recognize stroke symptoms:

F - Face drooping
A - Arm weakness
S - Speech difficulty
T - Time to call 911

Other symptoms may include sudden:
• Numbness/weakness on one side
• Confusion or trouble understanding
• Severe headache
• Vision problems
• Trouble walking or dizziness

CALL 911 IMMEDIATELY - rapid treatment is critical.

Do you need emergency contact information?

telemedicine_info.text:
Our telemedicine visits allow you to consult with healthcare providers from the comfort of your home. Benefits include:

• Convenience and accessibility
• Reduced travel and waiting time
• Access to specialists who may not be locally available
• Follow-up care without office visits

Telehealth visits are conducted using secure, HIPAA-compliant video platform. You'll need a device with internet access, camera, and microphone.

Would you like to schedule a telemedicine appointment?
